alert.note: Alert for Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 11:30AM EDT until June 29 at 12:15PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHEASTERN RICHLAND COUNTY... At 1130 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the showers and thunderstorms that produced the very heavy rainfall across the warned area are gradually weakening and moving slowly southward out of the warned area. Between 1.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.25 inches in 30 minutes. Additional rainfall amounts up to one half inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding and nuisance flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and rain gage reports. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... McEntire Air Base and Eastover. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25 INCHES IN 30 MINUTES
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report any flooding directly to the Columbia National Weather Service at 803 234 4115 when it is safe to do so. You can also send reports by Facebook or Twitter to NWSColumbia or by e-mail at NWS.Columbia@noaa.gov.
